CONCLUSION: Violation of Art. 6;Violation of P1-1;Pecuniary damage - financial award;Non-pecuniary damage - financial award;Costs and expenses award - Convention proceedings
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in Petrozavodsk .
CARDINAL . In DATE and DATE the applicant won QUANTITY cases in court against her former employer , a ORG - owned enterprise , and was awarded a sum of money .
CARDINAL . Consequently , enforcement proceedings were instituted by the bailiff and CARDINAL of the judgments was partly executed .
CARDINAL . On DATE the bailiff transmitted the materials relating to the enforcement proceedings to ORG as there were bankruptcy proceedings instituted in respect of the enterprise .

CARDINAL . The enterprise was declared bankrupt in DATE and its debts were considered as paid upon termination of the bankruptcy proceedings in DATE . No money was paid to the applicant due to the lack of funds .

CARDINAL . On an unspecified date the applicant instituted court proceedings against various public authorities seeking pecuniary and non - pecuniary damages for the non - enforcement of the court judgments . She claimed that the judgments had not been enforced due to the bailiff 's failure to take timely measures to facilitate their enforcement .

CARDINAL . On DATE the Petrozavodsk Town Court of GPE ORG городской суд PERSON ) ruled in the applicant 's favour . ORG found that during the period when the enforcement proceedings were managed by the bailiff , i.e. before DATE , the enterprise carried out economic activities and paid taxes . However , within that period the bailiff failed to take all the necessary measures to facilitate the timely enforcement of the court judgments . The applicant was awarded pecuniary damages in the amount of MONEY to be paid from ORG . Her claims for non - pecuniary damages were rejected .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG Верховный Суд Республики GPE ) upheld the judgment of ORG in the final instance .
CARDINAL . On DATE the bailiff instituted enforcement proceedings on the basis of the court judgment of DATE . The bailiff ordered ORG ( ORG РФ ) voluntarily to comply with the judgment by DATE .

CARDINAL . On an unspecified date in DATE , while the enforcement proceedings were still in progress , the President of ORG Суда Республики Карелия ) lodged an application for supervisory review ( протест в порядке надзора ) of the judgment of DATE and the decision of DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG of ORG Суда Республики Карелия ) decided to quash the said decisions on the grounds that they conflicted with procedural and substantive laws . The case was remitted for a new examination at first instance .

CARDINAL . On an unspecified date following the ORG 's decision the bailiff applied to the courts seeking to stay the enforcement proceedings until there was a final decision taken on the merits of the case .
CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG of GPE found that in the present circumstances the enforcement proceedings should be terminated rather than stayed .
CARDINAL . By decision of DATE ORG upheld the decision of ORG and decided in the final instance to terminate the enforcement proceedings .

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG of GPE delivered a new judgment on the merits , rejecting the applicant 's claims . ORG found that the bailiff had not been responsible for the non - enforcement of the court judgments as the enterprise lacked any assets at the relevant time .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG upheld the judgment of ORG in the final instance .

CARDINAL . Section CARDINAL of the Code of Civil Procedure of DATE ( Гражданский процессуальный кодекс РСФСР ) , as in force at the relevant time , provided that regional and higher courts could conduct supervisory review of the activities of the lower courts .

CARDINAL . According to Sections CARDINAL , CARDINAL and CARDINAL of the Code , certain senior judicial officers could , at any time , at request of the person concerned or on their own motion , lodge with a higher court an application for supervisory review of a final decision of a lower court on points of law and procedure .
